p: Colorectal cancer is the third most lethal cancer worldwide in both males and females with drug resistance and metastasis being the major challenge to effective treatments. Maximum deaths due to colon cancer are related with metastatic ailment. The growth of colorectal cancer is promoted by epigenetic factors, such as abnormal DNA methylation. Targeted therapy is a kind of chemotherapy that specifically targets the proteins that resist the development of some cancers [ 17].
